skill.name: threat-mitigation-mapping
skill.description: Map identified threats to appropriate security controls and mitigations. Use when prioritizing security investments, creating remediation plans, or validating control effectiveness.
skill.summary: Map identified threats to appropriate security controls and mitigations. Use when prioritizing secur...

security_audit.summary: The skill contains documentation and code templates for threat to control mapping. No data access, network calls, or execution behaviors are present.

content.user_title: Map threats to mitigations with clear controls
content.value_statement: You need to connect threats to concrete controls and priorities. This skill provides structured mappings, coverage scores, and gap insights.
actual_capabilities: Define threats, controls, and mappings in structured templates
Calculate coverage scores based on control status and effectiveness
Identify gaps for unmapped threats and weak coverage
Check defense in depth and control diversity
limitations: Requires user provided threat and control data
Templates do not integrate with live security tools
Does not automatically validate real world control effectiveness
Does not collect evidence from systems or logs

use_cases.title: Design layered defenses
use_cases.description: Map high risk threats to layered controls and verify defense in depth coverage.

use_cases.title: Plan remediation roadmap
use_cases.description: Prioritize control investments using coverage scores and gap analysis.

use_cases.title: Validate control coverage
use_cases.description: Align threat categories to controls for audit readiness and reporting.

prompt_templates.title: Start a mapping
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a basic threat to control mapping for three threats and show coverage scores using the provided template.

prompt_templates.title: Find gaps
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my current mappings and list threats with coverage below 50 percent and missing defense in depth.

prompt_templates.title: Prioritize controls
prompt_templates.prompt: Given a fixed budget and cost map, recommend controls that maximize risk reduction.

prompt_templates.title: Generate a report
prompt_templates.prompt: Produce a concise mitigation report with overall risk reduction, critical gaps, and a two phase roadmap.

output_examples.input: Map these STRIDE threats to controls and highlight gaps
output: Mapped 5 threats to 12 controls with coverage scores
Identified 2 critical gaps with no defense in depth
Suggested top 3 controls for the first phase

best_practices: Provide clear threat categories and risk scores
Use multiple control layers and types for each threat
Review mappings regularly as controls change
anti_patterns: Relying on a single control for high impact threats
Skipping coverage scoring and gap review
Treating templates as a substitute for validation

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It is prompt and template based, so it works across those platforms.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It does not ingest data automatically and needs your threat and control inputs.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my tooling?
faq.answer: You can adapt the templates to your data sources, but integration code is not included.

faq.question: Does it access or store sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. The skill is static content and has no data collection or network behavior.

faq.question: What if the coverage scores look wrong?
faq.answer: Check control status, effectiveness values, and threat mappings for accuracy.

faq.question: How is this different from a threat model?
faq.answer: It focuses on mapping threats to controls and planning mitigation actions.
